newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Varig and Martinair plan second Sao Paulo.
newsitem.headline: Varig and Martinair plan second Sao Paulo.

text.p: Varig Brazilian Airlines and Dutch carrier Martinair are to expand their joint service from Amsterdam to Sao Paulo with an extra MD-11 freighter flight a week, a spokesman for the Brazilian airline said.
Varig's cargo manager in the Netherlands, Dirk Hazenoot, told Reuters the new service will be launched early October.
In addition to an existing MD-11 flight to Sao Paulo, the two airlines will add another flight every Tuesday.
In November, the new service will switch to a Monday morning departure from Schiphol to reflect shipper demand, Hazenoot said.
He said Varig and Martinair, the latter of which is 50 percent owned by KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV, have experienced firm shipper interest in their joint service throughout the summer.
The two operate a sales policy whereby Varig sells space on the aircraft to the Brazilian market, and Martinair markets the aircraft to other South American shippers, he said.

Hazenoot added that Varig has good connections with the Brazilian automotive sector which has a constant demand for European car parts. He said rates have remained firm on the service throughout the summer and are currently holding at around 3.5 U.S. dollars per kg.
